I would like to request that the app on Android allow a custom notification sound and a custom ping sound, and preferably a different sound for each contact and group. Thank you.

The best aspect of this app is that it has encryption, so no outside party can simply steal or access your communication with someone. Has lots of great features but this app is very glitchy. The developers need to get on the ball and try to fix them or another communication app will simply eat their lunch and this will just be one of those "never made it to fame" apps.

Hopefully they will fix notifications soon. This is more private than whatsapp, doesn't collect all that metadata, and also, unlike whatsapp, they don't search/exploit/sell your chat history that's in cloud backups. But it's not as private as Wickr-me, although it does offer more features. I use Wire with people I trust, to protect our privacy. I relegate randoms to wickrme for anonymity.

replyText:
Hello,

You can send any file type up to 100MB if you are part of a team (Wire Basic, Wire for Enterprise or Wire for Governments), and as a private user you can send files up to 25MB.
For more information, please visit https://support.wire.com/hc/en-us/articles/208368315-Send-a-file

Thank you for your feedback,
Wire Customer Support
text: Cannot send original size files
Good

Great idea, mediocre execution. This app's cardinal sin is that it often doesn't notify that there is a new message. Furthermore, messages often do not go through without closing/reopening the app. And if a message doesn't go through there is no alert so you can re-send it. Lots of comical communication errors have occurred in my life resulting from this app's dysfunction. I love the idea and want it to work, but it's become very frustrating to use.

Why do I always get an error trying to play a video *I* recorded using the wire app?!?! Also constantly showing its offline when its clearly not. And not downloading mesaages until I actually open the app, so coworkers are always wondering why im not responding to messages I didnt get. The app is ok considering my company wants to use wire. But if I had another choice, id take it.
Only issue is I can't see notifications for my call. Love the fact that the chats are on one side of the screen.very clean. User friendly

I rely on Wire heavily as my primary communication platform with my family. It has not let me down at all over the years since I started using it. If I had any criticism it is that the app theming badly needs a refresh. It should be optional to have your profile picture as the background and main app colour. Great app in every other way though.

I really like that wire doesn't require your phone number just an email and sound quality on calls is better than other similar apps. But I give it only 3 stars due to one very annoying feature: it leaves squiggles behind after a message has timed out. That means if I wanna see a post that I've made permanent I need to scroll back over all the infinite squiggles. There should be an option to delete squiggles. What's the point to see the posts one cannot ever read anymore anyway?

replyText:
Hello,

Thank you for the feedback. We are sorry to hear that the application has not been up to your standards. We'd like to improve. Can you tell us more about what went wrong at https://support.wire.com/hc/en-us

Thanks,
Wire Costumer Support
text: get it together pls

Always loved this app but the issues are getting too bad to ignore. The biggest one is messages disappearing. I'll get a notification for a message but when I check it, it's gone. (they're not deleting it, they'll send screenshots showing that the message sent). When sending pics, the pic will show for a few seconds then disappear (without the delete timer on). Also, when I get a connection request, it often won't let me accept, so I have to decline then send a request to them.

text: A lot of improvement required.. Although being online all the time, wire tells me some messages might not be shown because I was offline a long time. Notifications for new messages are sometimes not shown, although having everything active. I must scroll the chat manually after sending/receiving a message. So far I prefer messaging via Telegram or Signal, because it's far more convenient and - in case of Signal - secure as well.
Oh my God! Is it even humanely possible to make an app that's this trash?. It's barely usable, scrolling is buggy, screen keeps flickering. I can't think one one good thing to say about this app.

This is one of those apps I've never gotten to work for more than a week, without having to clear its data/cache. It just gets extremely sluggish and unresponsive whenever I get a new message after this time period has passed. I have a high-end device so it's definitely not related to this.
A useful app for private messaging. Attractive layout and most useful features available.

It would be amazing to set timer for all messages for a person instead of individual messages. Still enjoy the app but would love bug's to be fixed.

Poor, lately have been having a constant blue bar scrolling across top of the screen in the app. Since its been there, app is very unresponsive and has a huge lag when typing and sending messages. Please fix or I will just use an alternative app. This used to be amazing but over the last few months it has gone down rapidly. If I could give zero stars I would have

The app is pretty good! It's pictures look exactly like how the app actually is, and all the features are great. Better then a regular texting app, although a few bugs I noticed. First, the app lets you choose a color for your app, I chose purple. Sometimes, that changes when I'm talking to someone and our name colors change. Second, the chat re-aranges sometimes, making messaging look confusing. This is fixed by restarting the app. Lastly, when messaging, the screen sometimes moves.
Do NOT download! Is it safe? Who knows.

It keeps getting better and better with every update. Nice UI and many features to enrich your chat and communicate easier. The devs should advertise it more. Keep up the good work! Edit (2022): Not good for privacy anymore. It's buggy and messages are getting lost often.
This app is a scam and could have very easily just have ruined my life

Fundamentally a good, free, ad-free, secure, and private messaging app. Rather buggy implementation, as yet, and after a few years use, we're only seeing more and more bugs, both on desktop and mobile. Most notably messages not showing, a message saying no internet though messages can still send and receive, (and other apps have internet access) lost history, lost login details, conflicting (leading to lost) accounts, CTD crashes and lockups.

Thank you for the feedback. For team members, the delete option is located on the team settings page; For free users, it can be found under Settings > Account > Delete account. If you need further assistance with deleting your account or confirmation of deletion, contact us at https://support.wire.com/hc/en-us

Thanks,
Wire Costumer Support
